config.question: How did the objectives of the Northwestern Alliance differ from the objectives of the Southern Alliance?

choices.content: The Northwest Alliance supported the Republicans whereas the Southern Alliance supported the Democrats.
The Northwestern Alliance disagreed with the Southerners’ emphasis on secrecy and centralized control.
Unlike the Southerners, the Northwestern Alliance formed a separate organization for African Americans.
The Northwestern Alliance turned to politics whereas the Southerners did not enter into the world of politics.

answer_3.response: Consider This: In 1889, the Southern Alliance changed its name to the National Farmers’ Alliance and Industrial Union. It persuaded the three strongest state alliances on the Plains to join. See L.O. 20.2 What factors led to the formation and growth of the Farmers’ Alliance and People’s party?
